001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
005
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Contact;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Exposure;
008
009/**
010 * This is a temporary data structure that gets generated during the update
011 * cycle to hold all the contact and exposures before they are written to the
012 * individual {@link io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonHistory} entries in the model. No
013 * effort is made in this class to ensure that added items are unique.
014 */
015public class PersonStateContacts implements Serializable {
016
017        // The contact network is an array of concurrent skip list maps. The index
018        // of this array is the id of the primary contact. This is initialised for
019        // the
020        // whole population up front during the update cycle, and does not have to
021        // be resized. The concurrent skip list maps hold the variable length of
022        // contactees. This is not enforced to be unique which is up to the provider
023        // The network is indexed by secondary contact id.
024
025        ConcurrentHashMap<Integer, Contact>[] network;
026        ConcurrentHashMap<Integer, Exposure>[] exposure;
027
028        /**
029         * nodes is essentially the number of people in the model. Max size is the
030         * maximum number of contacts they could make. In the worst case this will
031         * create a data structure 2*nodes*maxSize big.
032         *
033         * @param nodes   the number of people in the model
034         * @param maxSize the maximum number of contacts a person could make in a day
035         */
036        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
037        public PersonStateContacts(int nodes, int maxSize) {
038                this.network = new ConcurrentHashMap[nodes];
039                this.exposure = new ConcurrentHashMap[nodes];
040
041                for (var i = 0; i < nodes; i++) {
042                        this.network[i] = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
043                        this.exposure[i] = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
044                }
045        }
046
047        /**
048         * Get the contacts for a given id. This is not thread safe and should only
049         * be called after all updates have been made to the contact network for the
050         * day.
051         *
052         * @param ref the id of the person whose contacts we want to retrieve
053         * @return an array of Contact objects representing the contacts for the
054         *         given id
055         */
056        public Contact[] getContactsForId(Integer ref) {
057                return this.network[ref].values().toArray(j -> new Contact[j]);
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * Get the exposures for a given id. This is not thread safe and should only
062         * be called after all updates have been made to the exposure network for the
063         * day.
064         *
065         * @param ref the id of the person whose exposures we want to retrieve
066         * @return an array of Exposure objects representing the exposures for the
067         *         given id
068         */
069        public Exposure[] getExposuresForId(Integer ref) {
070                return this.exposure[ref].values().toArray(j -> new Exposure[j]);
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * Get the contact map for a given id. This can be used to write to the
075         * contact map for a given id. It is thread safe to write to the contact map
076         * for any given id concurrently.
077         *
078         * @param i the id of the person whose contact map we want to retrieve
079         * @return a ConcurrentHashMap representing the contact map for the given id
080         */
081        public ConcurrentHashMap<Integer, Contact> write(int i) {
082                return this.network[i];
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Get the exposure map for a given id.
087         *
088         * @param i the id of the person whose exposure map we want to retrieve
089         * @return a ConcurrentHashMap representing the exposure map for the given id
090         */
091        public ConcurrentHashMap<Integer, Exposure> writeExp(int i) {
092                return this.exposure[i];
093        }
094}
